posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: Our limelight as a static IP 10.TE. AM .2 and I was wondering you connect to it when tethered through USB.

posts.name: Tamer
posts.cooked:
If you setup port forwarding yes you can connect it while tethered. Check the official LL documentation for more info.

Event Preparation Checklist

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: Setting up Port Forwarding in the code as written does not work.

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: We also have two limelights

posts.name: Tamer
posts.cooked: Try the port forwarding code while having only one LL connected. Also are you using the second radio port?

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: Using a switch

TE.AM IP Notation: The notation TE.AM is used as part of IPs in numerous places in this document. This notation refers to splitting your four digit team number into two digit pairs for the IP addre...

The Rio should be .2. it is recommended to use .12-.19 for limelights, etc.

link_counts.title: IP Configurations — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked:
So connected only to robot via usb

IP on limelight is static at 10.8.29.13:5801 for the port Not able to access.

Port forwarding is setup as instructed in Robot.java.

posts.name: Tamer
posts.cooked: Can you try with only 1 LL . Maybe they have conflicting names or ips or ports or something like that? (Just writing things that I would do to identify the problem)

Make sure the limelights have different names….

Are you using “limelight.local” inside the for loop? Did you try “10.8.29.13” instead?

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: I did.  The limelight isnamed limelight-rear.local.  All that was setup first.  Just not able to see it over USB tether.

Something like this might work for 2 …

Limelight 1 would be 5801, Limelight 2 would be 5901

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: Already applied it.  Just working with one at the moment

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: The rio’s ip when tethered to USB is 172.22.11.2
Yes… 172.22.11.2:5801 would take you to limelight-1.local

In a browser you put 172.22.11.2:5801

Which is the Rio. The Rio then forwards the request to the limelight using the limelight’s IP address and the port setup in the forward.

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: makes sense now.

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked:
So I was able to see one of them through port 172.22.11.2:5801

I wasn’t able to see the other trying the trick you mentioned up above by adding 100 to the port forward.  I’m going to try again later today.

posts.name: Nicholas Armstrong
posts.cooked: So an update.  I can only port forward the one with the lowest up address.  Adding 100 for the other one just forwards the first one again
